Class antie.Application


Extends antie.Class.

Defined in: application.js.

Class Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
antie.Application(rootElement, styleBaseURL, imageBaseURL, onReadyHandler, configOverride)
Abstract base class for Bigscreen applications.

Class Detail
antie.Application(rootElement, styleBaseURL, imageBaseURL, onReadyHandler, configOverride)
Abstract base class for Bigscreen applications.
Parameters:
{DOMElement} rootElement
DOMElement into which to render the application.
{String} styleBaseURL
URL pointing to path stylesheets are relative to.
{String} imageBaseURL
URL pointing to path images are relative to.
{function(Event)} onReadyHandler
Function called when application is ready.
{Object} configOverride Optional
Optional config to override default.
Requires:
antie.widgets.ComponentContainer
antie.widgets.List
Method Detail
<private> _setFocussedWidget(widget)
Set the currently focussed Button.
Parameters:
{antie.widgets.Button} widget
The antie.widgets.Button that has recieved focus.
addComponentContainer(id, modules, args)
Add a component container to the application.
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the new component container.
{String} modules Optional
The requirejs module name of the component to pre-load.
{Object} args Optional
An optional object to pass arguments into any pre-loaded component.
addEventListener(evt, handler)
Adds an event listener to the root widget. This is the last point of call for events bubbled up through the UI.
Parameters:
{String} evt
The event to handle.
{function(Event)} handler
The handler function to call when the event hits the root widget.
broadcastEvent(evt)
Broadcasts an event from the application level to every single object it contains.
Parameters:
{antie.events.Event} evt
The event to broadcast.
bubbleEvent(evt)
Bubbles an event from the currently focussed widget up through the widget tree.
Parameters:
{antie.events.Event} evt
The event to bubble.
destroy()
Destroys the application, allowing you to run another. This is mainly for use when building unit or BDD tests.
getBestFitLayout()
Gets the largest supported layout that fits within the available screen resolution.
Returns:
An object literal describing which layout module to load.
getComponent(id)
Gets a component by ID.
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the container to return.
<static> antie.Application.getCurrentApplication()
Returns the currently executing application.
getCurrentRoute()
Gets the current route (a reference pointing to a location within the application).
Returns:
The current route (location within the application).
getDevice()
Returns the Device object currently running this application.
Returns:
The antie.devices.Device object currently running this application.
getFocussedWidget()
Returns the currently-focussed Button.
Returns:
The antie.widgets.Button which currently has focus.
getLayout()
Gets the current layout as set by {@see #setLayout}.
Returns:
An application-specific object literal describing layout-specific properties.
getReferer()
Gets the reference (e.g. URL) of the resource that launched the application or the previous location within the application.
Returns:
A reference (e.g. URL) of the previous location.
getRootWidget()
Get the root widget of the application.
Returns:
The root widget of the application.
hideComponent(id)
Hides a component.
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the container that contains the component to hide.
popComponent(id)
Pops a component from the history stack of a container (if a previous component exists)
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the container that contains the component to pop.
pushComponent(id, modules, args)
Pushes a component into the history stack of a container (and shows it).
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the container into which to show the component.
{String} modules
The requirejs module name of the component to show.
{Object} args Optional
An optional object to pass arguments to the component.
ready()
Must be called when the application startup is complete and application can accept user input.
removeEventListener(evt, handler)
Removes an event listener from the root widget.
Parameters:
{String} evt
The event to handle.
{function(Event)} handler
The handler function to remove.
route(route)
Called after #run to launch the application at a specific location.
Parameters:
{Array} route
Location of application.
run()
Called once application startup is ready (i.e. config has been loaded).
setActiveComponent(id)
Sets the active focus to the specified component.
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the container that contains the component to set focus on.
setCurrentRoute(route)
Sets the current route (a reference pointing to a location within the application).
Parameters:
{Array} route
A route pointing to a location within the application.
setLayout(layout, styleBaseUrl, imageBaseUrl, additionalCSS, additionalClasses, additionalPreloadImages, callback)
Sets the current layout used by the application.
Parameters:
{Object} layout
An application-specific object literal describing layout-specific properties
{String} styleBaseUrl
Base URL of stylesheets for the application.
{String} imageBaseUrl
Base URL of images for the application.
{Array} additionalCSS Optional
Additional stylesheet URLs to load.
{Array} additionalClasses Optional
Additional classes to add to the document element.
{Array} additionalPreloadImages Optional
Additional images to preload.
{function()} callback Optional
Callback function to call when layout has been fully loaded.
setRootWidget(widget)
Set the root widget of the application.
Parameters:
{antie.widgets.Widget} widget
The new root widget.
showComponent(id, modules, args)
Show a component in a component container. This resets any history for the container.
Parameters:
{String} id
The ID of the container into which to show the component.
{String} modules
The requirejs module name of the component to show.
{Object} args Optional
An optional object to pass arguments to the component.
See:
#pushComponent
